DataElement.preferredDefinition: The end date related to tumor involvement of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract which consists of the upper GI tract comprising the mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach and the lower GI tract that consists of intestines and anus.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to involvement of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract which consists of the upper GI tract comprising the mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach and the lower GI tract that consists of intestines and anus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Concepts.definition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Property.preferredDefinition: Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

Concepts.definition: Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation or an event ended.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/23/17 jk transferred context, cap first letter in def, and added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Last day of known tumor invad
ReferenceDocuments.description: Last day of known tumor invading the GI tract

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Last day of known tumor with invasion into the GI tract from the outside causing increased risk of perforation or bleeding
